intro: [WRONG START] Achillea impatiens subsp. ledeburii, commonly known as the Alpine yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features basal rosettes of silver-gray, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped umbels. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine climates. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in high-altitude ecosystems.
